body: Is this still an issue if you upgrade to tauri.rs - beta.8 or the next branch?

Yep, just tried it with a release build (no `--debug` flag) on `next`.

----------------------------
Also, as a sidenote: notifications still have the `Windows Powershell` title…

> Yep, just tried it with a release build (no --debug flag) on next.

hmm, imo it looks like something specific to your icon tbh. (the `tauri icon` command is a little unfriendly at times :/ )
Can you try other icons/image editors/export methods? No idea otherwise, sorry.

> Also, as a sidenote: notifications still have the Windows Powershell title…

Whoops my bad. Looks like it's tied to the msi installation (So if you distribute your app via the msi, it should be fine)

> hmm, imo it looks like something specific to your icon tbh. (the tauri icon command is a little unfriendly at times :/ )
Can you try other icons/image editors/export methods? No idea otherwise, sorry.

OK, I'll try a random different file. It is pretty strange though that it works in every other place except this one.

> Whoops my bad. Looks like it's tied to the msi installation (So if you distribute your app via the msi, it should be fine)

I see, it indeed is, and it also has an icon of the app

So, I've tried
- a different PNG, converted it by the `tauri icon` tool & got the same thing ... it worked everywhere except try area
- downloaded a random `ico` file from the internet and replaced the generated one, and now it works in the tray area too (albeit a bit rough around the edges, but that is not the point for now)

-------------------------------------

- `ico` is from here: https://findicons.com/icon/64873/download
- this is the second `png` I've tried: [icon](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11244314/135503247-bd024cd9-5e17-42aa-b20f-7158ec216697.png)

-------------------------------------

Now, as far as I can tell just by hindsight, the difference seems to be that the `ico` you are generating is compressed.
Might that be the core of the problem?

I have just tried both compression algorithms you declare as supported and the result is the same.

Can the compression be disabled and left to users to [`pngcrush`](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pngcrush) the `png` images?

I tested a lot of PNG->ICO libraries and methods (one online conversion site worked, one didn't) and png2icons is definitely not working so well here. I tried https://github.com/steambap/png-to-ico and it works nice, so I made a PR to use that instead.

Can you test that @kubijo ?
Sure thing, first thing in the morning... What do I do? `cargo update`, build and see?
You'll need to clone the repo, build the tooling/CLI.js package and run the icon command from it.

Sorry for the delay… slow day both for me and for the computer it seems…

Anyway, the update seems to have worked nicely! :+1: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11244314/135607267-63fa8b37-4207-4d31-b214-dd11a11c3a91.png)

------------------------------------------

If this was an application to be deployed, my next effort in this regard would be to solve the icon quality in these small dimensions.

It is tangential to this issue, but it would be interesting to known if you plan to address that in some way as well, or if that is to be solved by users themselves.

The only way to solve this I see would be to generate an `ico` file with hand-designed sizes because scaling can only do so much…
It seems that this might also be accomplished by `ImageMagick` (available cross-platform): https://superuser.com/a/683203
I think I can skip resizing if the image is squared. Otherwise there's not much to do.

That is not the whole story though ... the point is to have an `ico` file with multiple sizes where potentially any of them can be custom designed because you can't use a design for 256×256 scaled down 16×16 and expect it to look nice

It would, however, be understandable if this was considered out of the scope for that script since there is potentially a lot of complexity that you might not want to tackle...

… so I'm basically just saying that this is an issue that needs to be addressed in one way or another if Tauri user wants nice looking windows icons & it's a question if you want to address that in your tooling and/or documentation

issue.title: System Tray Icon is invisible

repository.name: Vital-Utilities
repository.description: Vital Utilities. Modern Windows Task Manager alternative with bells and whistles

issue.body: Have to wait for Tauri v1 to release as i wont target vNext branch. https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/2692
